projects.title: Hello World! Program
projects.description: Create a program that prints `Hello, World!` to the screen.
projects.hint: Use the [std::cout](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/io/cout) stream to print text to the console.

projects.title: Numbers 1 to 10
projects.description: Display the numbers from 1 to 10 on the screen.
projects.hint: Use a `for` loop to iterate from 1 to 10 and print each number. [Learn more about for loops](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/for)

projects.title: Square Pattern of Stars
projects.description: Print a square made of `*` symbols in a grid format.
projects.hint: Use nested `for` loops to print a square pattern. [Learn more about nested loops](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/for)

projects.title: Sum of First 10 Numbers
projects.description: Calculate and display the sum of numbers from 1 to 10.
projects.hint: Use a `for` loop to iterate from 1 to 10 and accumulate the sum. [Learn about for loops](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/for)

projects.title: Simple GUI Application
projects.description: Create a basic graphical user interface with text and buttons.
projects.hint: Consider using a GUI library like Qt or GTK. [Learn more about Qt](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5.15/index.html), [Learn about GTK](https://www.gtk.org/docs)

projects.title: Print Your Name Multiple Times
projects.description: Print your name 5 times on the screen.
projects.hint: Use a `for` loop to print your name multiple times. [Learn more about loops](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/for)

projects.title: Even Numbers from 2 to 20
projects.description: Display even numbers starting from 2 up to 20.
projects.hint: Use a `for` loop with a step of 2 to print even numbers. [Learn about steps in loops](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/for)

projects.title: Countdown from 10 to 1
projects.description: Create a countdown starting from 10 and ending at 1.
projects.hint: Use a `for` loop to iterate from 10 to 1 and print each number. [Learn more about loops](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/for)

projects.title: Alphabet A to Z
projects.description: Print the alphabet from A to Z.
projects.hint: Use a `for` loop to iterate through ASCII values of letters. [Learn more about ASCII](https://www.asciitable.com/)

projects.title: Triangle of Stars
projects.description: Print a triangle shape using `*` symbols.
projects.hint: Use nested `for` loops to print a triangle pattern. [Learn about nested loops](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/for)

projects.title: Factorial Calculator
projects.description: Calculate the factorial of a given number.
projects.hint: Use a `for` loop to multiply numbers from 1 to the given number. [Learn about factorials](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Factorial)

projects.title: Even or Odd Number Checker
projects.description: Check if a number is even or odd.
projects.hint: Use the modulus operator `%` to check for even or odd. [Learn about modulus operator](https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/modulo-operator-in-c-cpp-with-examples/)

projects.title: Multiplication Table
projects.description: Print the multiplication table for a given number.
projects.hint: Use nested `for` loops to print the multiplication table. [Learn about nested loops](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/for)

projects.title: Greatest Common Divisor (GCD)
projects.description: Find the greatest common divisor of two numbers.
projects.hint: Use the Euclidean algorithm to find the GCD. [Learn more about GCD](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greatest_common_divisor)

projects.title: Palindrome Checker
projects.description: Check if a number is a palindrome.
projects.hint: Convert the number to a string and check if it reads the same backward. [Learn about palindromes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Palindrome)

projects.title: Fibonacci Sequence
projects.description: Generate the nth Fibonacci number.
projects.hint: Use a loop or recursion to generate Fibonacci numbers. [Learn about Fibonacci](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fibonacci_sequence)

projects.title: Celsius to Fahrenheit Converter
projects.description: Convert a temperature from Celsius to Fahrenheit.
projects.hint: Use the formula `F = C * 9/5 + 32` for conversion. [Learn more about temperature conversion](https://www.rapidtables.com/convert/temperature/celsius-to-fahrenheit.html)

projects.title: Vowel Counter
projects.description: Count the number of vowels in a string.
projects.hint: Use a loop to iterate through the string and count vowels. [Learn more about string manipulation](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/string/basic_string)

projects.title: String Reversal
projects.description: Reverse a given string.
projects.hint: Use the [std::reverse](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/algorithm/reverse) function or a loop to reverse the string.

projects.title: Largest Number in an Array
projects.description: Find the largest number in an array.
projects.hint: Use a loop to iterate through the array and find the maximum value. [Learn about arrays](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/container/array)

projects.title: Matrix Addition
projects.description: Add two matrices together.
projects.hint: Use nested loops to iterate through matrices and add corresponding elements. [Learn more about matrices](https://www.wikiwand.com/en/articles/Matrix)

projects.title: Bubble Sort
projects.description: Sort an array using the bubble sort algorithm.
projects.hint: Implement the bubble sort algorithm to sort the array. [Learn more about bubble sort](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bubble_sort)

projects.title: Prime Number Checker
projects.description: Check if a given number is prime.
projects.hint: Use a loop to check if the number has any divisors other than 1 and itself. [Learn about prime numbers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_number)

projects.title: Basic Calculator
projects.description: Create a basic calculator that can add, subtract, multiply, and divide.
projects.hint: Use `switch` statements to perform different arithmetic operations. [Learn about switch statements](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/switch)

projects.title: Random Number Generator
projects.description: Generate a pseudo-random number between 1 and 100.
projects.hint: Use the random number library to generate pseudo-random numbers. [Learn more about the random number library](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/numeric/random)

projects.title: Anagram Checker
projects.description: Check if a word is an anagram of another word.
projects.hint: Sort both words and compare if they are equal. [Learn more about anagrams](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anagram)

projects.title: Dice Rolling Simulator
projects.description: Simulate rolling a pair of dice.
projects.hint: Use the random number library to generate pseudo-random numbers between 1 and 6. [Learn about the random number library](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/numeric/random)

projects.title: Number Guessing Game
projects.description: Make a program that lets the user guess a number the computer randomly selects.
projects.hint: Use a random number generator and conditional statements to check guesses.

projects.title: Temperature Logger
projects.description: Store a series of temperature readings and compute average, highest, and lowest values.
projects.hint: Use a vector to store readings and iterate to calculate statistics.

projects.title: Simple Bank Account System
projects.description: Create a program that allows deposit, withdrawal, and balance checking operations.
projects.hint: Use functions or a class to encapsulate account operations.

projects.title: File Word Counter
projects.description: Count how many times each word appears in a given text file.
projects.hint: Use std::map to store words and counts, and file input streams to read data.

projects.title: Student Grades Manager
projects.description: Create a program that stores student data and calculates average grades.
projects.hint: Use structs or classes to store name, roll number, and grades.

projects.title: Tic-Tac-Toe Game
projects.description: Create a simple 2-player Tic-Tac-Toe game for console.
projects.hint: Use a 3x3 array and alternating turns to track X and O moves.

projects.title: Rock-Paper-Scissors Game
projects.description: Simulate a rock-paper-scissors game between user and computer.
projects.hint: Use conditionals to determine game outcomes.
